Minor Hudson and Harlem Line Schedule Adjustments Effective August 1

Minor schedule adjustments will be made on the Hudson and Harlem lines on Monday, August 1. On the Hudson Line, due to continued progress on the Sandy Resiliency Project, changes will include substitute bus service at Philipse Manor and Scarborough during AM Reverse Peak and PM Reverse Peak periods. See busing details at http://bit.ly/29WMpV0 . On the Harlem Line, the 6:45 AM train from Southeast to Grand Central will now depart Southeast at 6:42 AM. After Goldens Bridge, the train will follow its current schedule, with no change to the arrival time at Grand Central Terminal. . There are no service changes on the New Haven Line. See more schedule details at http://bit.ly/2afBPLj New timetables are available in Grand Central, at outlying stations, or view our schedules page at http://bit.ly/1arccwk

Beginning August 1, certain weekday "reverse peak" trains will not stop at Philipse Manor and Scarborough stations. During these times, customers will connect with shuttle buses at Tarrytown station for travel to/from Philipse Manor and Scarborough. See full details on busing at http://bit.ly/29WMpV0 This change is being done to accommodate construction work related to our Superstorm Sandy Recovery effort.
Minor Hudson and Harlem Line Schedule Adjustments Effective August 1

Minor schedule adjustments will be made on the Hudson and Harlem lines on Monday, August 1. On the Hudson Line, due to continued progress on the Sandy Resiliency Project, changes will include substitute bus service at Philipse Manor and Scarborough during AM Reverse Peak and PM Reverse Peak periods. See busing details at http://bit.ly/29WMpV0 . On the Harlem Line, the 6:45 AM train from Southeast to Grand Central will now depart Southeast at 6:42 AM. After Goldens Bridge, the train will follow its current schedule, with no change to the arrival time at Grand Central Terminal. There are no service changes on the New Haven Line. See more schedule details at http://bit.ly/2afBPLj New timetables are available in Grand Central, at outlying stations, or view our schedules page at http://bit.ly/1arccwk
Substitute Busing on New Canaan Branch, July 22 - Aug. 21

Substitute busing will be provided between New Canaan and Stamford stations for select trains on Fridays, and for all trains on Saturdays and Sundays, beginning Friday, July 22 through August 21. Note: Buses will operate 15 to 20 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Please listen for announcements and check local or express bus service to your destination when boarding. Service changes will allow for renewal work on grade crossings. We appreciate your patience during this infrastructure improvement. To see the full schedule, click here http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/NewCanaanBus_714.pdf
Grand Central Bound Trains Will Not Stop at Melrose Weekend of July 30-31; Substitute Buses Operate Between Tremont and Melrose

Grand Central Bound Trains will not stop at Melrose on Sat., July 30 & Sun., July 31 to accommodate track work. Weekend southbound busing will take place between Tremont and Melrose stations. Southbound customers traveling to Melrose station will be provided with connecting bus service from Tremont to Melrose. For all southbound customers at Melrose Station buses will be provided to Tremont for connecting train service. See full bus/train schedule details at http://bit.ly/2a6yVI9 We appreciate your patience during this service improvement.

Grand Central Bound Trains Will Not Stop at Melrose Weekend of July 30-31; Substitute Buses Operate Between Tremont and Melrose

Grand Central Bound Trains will not stop at Melrose on Sat., July 30 & Sun., July 31 to accommodate track work. Weekend southbound busing will take place between Tremont and Melrose stations. Southbound customers traveling to Melrose station will be provided with connecting bus service from Tremont to Melrose. For all southbound customers at Melrose Station buses will be provided to Tremont for connecting train service. See full bus/train schedule details at http://bit.ly/2a6yVI9 We appreciate your patience during this service improvement.
Substitute Busing on New Canaan Branch, July 22 - Aug. 21

Substitute busing will be provided between New Canaan and Stamford stations for select trains on Fridays, and for all trains on Saturdays and Sundays, beginning Friday, July 22 through August 21. Note: Buses will operate 15 to 20 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Please listen for announcements and check local or express bus service to your destination when boarding. Service changes will allow for renewal work on grade crossings. We appreciate your patience during this infrastructure improvement. To see the full schedule, click here http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/NewCanaanBus_714.pdf
Minor Hudson and Harlem Line Schedule Adjustments Effective August 1

Minor schedule adjustments will be made on the Hudson and Harlem lines on Monday, August 1. On the Hudson Line, due to continued progress on the Sandy Resiliency Project, changes will include substitute bus service at Philipse Manor and Scarborough during AM Reverse Peak and PM Reverse Peak periods. See busing details at http://bit.ly/29WMpV0 . On the Harlem Line, the 6:45 AM train from Southeast to Grand Central will now depart Southeast at 6:42 AM. After Goldens Bridge, the train will follow its current schedule, with no change to the arrival time at Grand Central Terminal. There are no service changes on the New Haven Line. See more schedule details at http://bit.ly/2afBPLj New timetables are available in Grand Central, at outlying stations, or view our schedules page at http://bit.ly/1arccwk
Weekday Reverse Peak Busing at Philipse Manor & Scarborough Begins August 1

Beginning August 1, certain weekday "reverse peak" trains will not stop at Philipse Manor and Scarborough stations. During these times, customers will connect with shuttle buses at Tarrytown station for travel to/from Philipse Manor and Scarborough. See full details on busing at http://bit.ly/29WMpV0 This change is being done to accommodate construction work related to our Superstorm Sandy Recovery effort.

Grand Central Bound Trains Will Not Stop at Melrose Weekend of July 30-31; Substitute Buses Operate Between Tremont and Melrose

Grand Central Bound Trains will not stop at Melrose on Sat., July 30 & Sun., July 31 to accommodate track work. Weekend southbound busing will take place between Tremont and Melrose stations. Southbound customers traveling to Melrose station will be provided with connecting bus service from Tremont to Melrose. For all southbound customers at Melrose Station buses will be provided to Tremont for connecting train service. See full bus/train schedule details at http://bit.ly/2a6yVI9 We appreciate your patience during this service improvement.
Montauk Eastbound Train Operating 17 Minutes Late

Substitute Busing on New Canaan Branch, July 22 - Aug. 21

Substitute busing will be provided between New Canaan and Stamford stations for select trains on Fridays, and for all trains on Saturdays and Sundays, beginning Friday, July 22 through August 21. Note: Buses will operate 15 to 20 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Please listen for announcements and check local or express bus service to your destination when boarding. Service changes will allow for renewal work on grade crossings. We appreciate your patience during this infrastructure improvement. To see the full schedule, click here http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/NewCanaanBus_714.pdf
Minor Hudson and Harlem Line Schedule Adjustments Effective August 1

Minor schedule adjustments will be made on the Hudson and Harlem lines on Monday, August 1. On the Hudson Line, due to continued progress on the Sandy Resiliency Project, changes will include substitute bus service at Philipse Manor and Scarborough during AM Reverse Peak and PM Reverse Peak periods. See busing details at http://bit.ly/29WMpV0 . On the Harlem Line, the 6:45 AM train from Southeast to Grand Central will now depart Southeast at 6:42 AM. After Goldens Bridge, the train will follow its current schedule, with no change to the arrival time at Grand Central Terminal. There are no service changes on the New Haven Line. See more schedule details at http://bit.ly/2afBPLj New timetables are available in Grand Central, at outlying stations, or view our schedules page at http://bit.ly/1arccwk
Weekday Reverse Peak Busing at Philipse Manor & Scarborough Begins August 1

Beginning August 1, certain weekday "reverse peak" trains will not stop at Philipse Manor and Scarborough stations. During these times, customers will connect with shuttle buses at Tarrytown station for travel to/from Philipse Manor and Scarborough. See full details on busing at http://bit.ly/29WMpV0 This change is being done to accommodate construction work related to our Superstorm Sandy Recovery effort.

Grand Central Bound Trains Will Not Stop at Melrose Weekend of July 30-31; Substitute Buses Operate Between Tremont and Melrose

Grand Central Bound Trains will not stop at Melrose on Sat., July 30 & Sun., July 31 to accommodate track work. Weekend southbound busing will take place between Tremont and Melrose stations. Southbound customers traveling to Melrose station will be provided with connecting bus service from Tremont to Melrose. For all southbound customers at Melrose Station buses will be provided to Tremont for connecting train service. See full bus/train schedule details at http://bit.ly/2a6yVI9 We appreciate your patience during this service improvement.
Substitute Busing on New Canaan Branch, July 22 - Aug. 21

Substitute busing will be provided between New Canaan and Stamford stations for select trains on Fridays, and for all trains on Saturdays and Sundays, beginning Friday, July 22 through August 21. Note: Buses will operate 15 to 20 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Please listen for announcements and check local or express bus service to your destination when boarding. Service changes will allow for renewal work on grade crossings. We appreciate your patience during this infrastructure improvement. To see the full schedule, click here http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/NewCanaanBus_714.pdf
Minor Hudson and Harlem Line Schedule Adjustments Effective August 1

Minor schedule adjustments will be made on the Hudson and Harlem lines on Monday, August 1. On the Hudson Line, due to continued progress on the Sandy Resiliency Project, changes will include substitute bus service at Philipse Manor and Scarborough during AM Reverse Peak and PM Reverse Peak periods. See busing details at http://bit.ly/29WMpV0 . On the Harlem Line, the 6:45 AM train from Southeast to Grand Central will now depart Southeast at 6:42 AM. After Goldens Bridge, the train will follow its current schedule, with no change to the arrival time at Grand Central Terminal. There are no service changes on the New Haven Line. See more schedule details at http://bit.ly/2afBPLj New timetables are available in Grand Central, at outlying stations, or view our schedules page at http://bit.ly/1arccwk
Weekday Reverse Peak Busing at Philipse Manor & Scarborough Begins August 1

Beginning August 1, certain weekday "reverse peak" trains will not stop at Philipse Manor and Scarborough stations. During these times, customers will connect with shuttle buses at Tarrytown station for travel to/from Philipse Manor and Scarborough. See full details on busing at http://bit.ly/29WMpV0 This change is being done to accommodate construction work related to our Superstorm Sandy Recovery effort.
FINAL: QMT: FAST TRACK SANDY RESTORATION WORK

Minor Hudson and Harlem Line Schedule Adjustments Effective August 1

Minor schedule adjustments will be made on the Hudson and Harlem lines on Monday, August 1. On the Hudson Line, due to continued progress on the Sandy Resiliency Project, changes will include substitute bus service at Philipse Manor and Scarborough during AM Reverse Peak and PM Reverse Peak periods. See busing details at http://bit.ly/29WMpV0 . On the Harlem Line, the 6:45 AM train from Southeast to Grand Central will now depart Southeast at 6:42 AM. After Goldens Bridge, the train will follow its current schedule, with no change to the arrival time at Grand Central Terminal. There are no service changes on the New Haven Line. See more schedule details at http://bit.ly/2afBPLj New timetables are available in Grand Central, at outlying stations, or view our schedules page at http://bit.ly/1arccwk
Substitute Busing on New Canaan Branch, July 22 - Aug. 21

Substitute busing will be provided between New Canaan and Stamford stations for select trains on Fridays, and for all trains on Saturdays and Sundays, beginning Friday, July 22 through August 21. Note: Buses will operate 15 to 20 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Please listen for announcements and check local or express bus service to your destination when boarding. Service changes will allow for renewal work on grade crossings. We appreciate your patience during this infrastructure improvement. To see the full schedule, click here http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/NewCanaanBus_714.pdf
Grand Central Bound Trains Will Not Stop at Melrose Weekend of July 30-31; Substitute Buses Operate Between Tremont and Melrose

Grand Central Bound Trains will not stop at Melrose on Sat., July 30 & Sun., July 31 to accommodate track work. Weekend southbound busing will take place between Tremont and Melrose stations. Southbound customers traveling to Melrose station will be provided with connecting bus service from Tremont to Melrose. For all southbound customers at Melrose Station buses will be provided to Tremont for connecting train service. See full bus/train schedule details at http://bit.ly/2a6yVI9 We appreciate your patience during this service improvement.
Weekday Reverse Peak Busing at Philipse Manor & Scarborough Begins August 1

Beginning August 1, certain weekday "reverse peak" trains will not stop at Philipse Manor and Scarborough stations. During these times, customers will connect with shuttle buses at Tarrytown station for travel to/from Philipse Manor and Scarborough. See full details on busing at http://bit.ly/29WMpV0 This change is being done to accommodate construction work related to our Superstorm Sandy Recovery effort.

Weekday Reverse Peak Busing at Philipse Manor & Scarborough Begins August 1

Beginning August 1, certain weekday "reverse peak" trains will not stop at Philipse Manor and Scarborough stations. During these times, customers will connect with shuttle buses at Tarrytown station for travel to/from Philipse Manor and Scarborough. See full details on busing at http://bit.ly/29WMpV0 This change is being done to accommodate construction work related to our Superstorm Sandy Recovery effort.
Grand Central Bound Trains Will Not Stop at Melrose Weekend of July 30-31; Substitute Buses Operate Between Tremont and Melrose

Grand Central Bound Trains will not stop at Melrose on Sat., July 30 & Sun., July 31 to accommodate track work. Weekend southbound busing will take place between Tremont and Melrose stations. Southbound customers traveling to Melrose station will be provided with connecting bus service from Tremont to Melrose. For all southbound customers at Melrose Station buses will be provided to Tremont for connecting train service. See full bus/train schedule details at http://bit.ly/2a6yVI9 We appreciate your patience during this service improvement.

Minor Hudson and Harlem Line Schedule Adjustments Effective August 1

Minor schedule adjustments will be made on the Hudson and Harlem lines on Monday, August 1. On the Hudson Line, due to continued progress on the Sandy Resiliency Project, changes will include substitute bus service at Philipse Manor and Scarborough during AM Reverse Peak and PM Reverse Peak periods. See busing details at http://bit.ly/29WMpV0 . On the Harlem Line, the 6:45 AM train from Southeast to Grand Central will now depart Southeast at 6:42 AM. After Goldens Bridge, the train will follow its current schedule, with no change to the arrival time at Grand Central Terminal. There are no service changes on the New Haven Line. See more schedule details at http://bit.ly/2afBPLj New timetables are available in Grand Central, at outlying stations, or view our schedules page at http://bit.ly/1arccwk

Substitute Busing on New Canaan Branch, July 22 - Aug. 21

Substitute busing will be provided between New Canaan and Stamford stations for select trains on Fridays, and for all trains on Saturdays and Sundays, beginning Friday, July 22 through August 21. Note: Buses will operate 15 to 20 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Please listen for announcements and check local or express bus service to your destination when boarding. Service changes will allow for renewal work on grade crossings. We appreciate your patience during this infrastructure improvement. To see the full schedule, click here http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/NewCanaanBus_714.pdf

Weekday Reverse Peak Busing at Philipse Manor & Scarborough Begins August 1

Beginning August 1, certain weekday "reverse peak" trains will not stop at Philipse Manor and Scarborough stations. During these times, customers will connect with shuttle buses at Tarrytown station for travel to/from Philipse Manor and Scarborough. See full details on busing at http://bit.ly/29WMpV0 This change is being done to accommodate construction work related to our Superstorm Sandy Recovery effort.

Grand Central Bound Trains Will Not Stop at Melrose Weekend of July 30-31; Substitute Buses Operate Between Tremont and Melrose

Grand Central Bound Trains will not stop at Melrose on Sat., July 30 & Sun., July 31 to accommodate track work. Weekend southbound busing will take place between Tremont and Melrose stations. Southbound customers traveling to Melrose station will be provided with connecting bus service from Tremont to Melrose. For all southbound customers at Melrose Station buses will be provided to Tremont for connecting train service. See full bus/train schedule details at http://bit.ly/2a6yVI9 We appreciate your patience during this service improvement.
Minor Hudson and Harlem Line Schedule Adjustments Effective August 1

Minor schedule adjustments will be made on the Hudson and Harlem lines on Monday, August 1. On the Hudson Line, due to continued progress on the Sandy Resiliency Project, changes will include substitute bus service at Philipse Manor and Scarborough during AM Reverse Peak and PM Reverse Peak periods. See busing details at http://bit.ly/29WMpV0 . On the Harlem Line, the 6:45 AM train from Southeast to Grand Central will now depart Southeast at 6:42 AM. After Goldens Bridge, the train will follow its current schedule, with no change to the arrival time at Grand Central Terminal. There are no service changes on the New Haven Line. See more schedule details at http://bit.ly/2afBPLj New timetables are available in Grand Central, at outlying stations, or view our schedules page at http://bit.ly/1arccwk

Grand Central Bound Trains Will Not Stop at Melrose Weekend of July 30-31; Substitute Buses Operate Between Tremont and Melrose

Grand Central Bound Trains will not stop at Melrose on Sat., July 30 & Sun., July 31 to accommodate track work. Weekend southbound busing will take place between Tremont and Melrose stations. Southbound customers traveling to Melrose station will be provided with connecting bus service from Tremont to Melrose. For all southbound customers at Melrose Station buses will be provided to Tremont for connecting train service. See full bus/train schedule details at http://bit.ly/2a6yVI9 We appreciate your patience during this service improvement.
Weekday Reverse Peak Busing at Philipse Manor & Scarborough Begins August 1

Beginning August 1, certain weekday "reverse peak" trains will not stop at Philipse Manor and Scarborough stations. MTA Announces Construction Plan Decision Using Public Feedback

Hello, Thank you for your interest and feedback concerning the L Canarsie Tunnel Reconstruction Project. Yesterday, we announced the decision to close the tunnel for 18 months beginning in 2019, so that we can address as quickly and efficiently as possible the critical work needed in the tunnel's two tubes. In 2012, Superstorm Sandy flooded the tubes with seven million gallons of salt water, heavily damaging vital infrastructure and systems. Service was restored some 10 days later, and conditions were and continue to be closely monitored. While the tunnels are safe, a full reconstruction is required. After a robust public outreach process over the last few months, and based on the needs of the system and the impact to our customers, we decided that closing the entire tunnel for 18 months was the best approach to the rebuilding process. Now that the decision is made, we are committed to soliciting your feedback on plans for alternative services, and keeping you informed once work begins. We invite you to visit our Canarsie Tunnel Reconstruction microsite: http://web.mta.info/sandy/rebuildingCanarsieTunnel.html which is maintained for this very purpose. Our goal is to continuously provide you with content relevant to the project work, and enhance the information to reflect your questions, interests and concerns. We encourage you to explore the microsite where you will find photographs, maps, a cross section of the tunnel, and overall details that illustrate the work needed to both fix and fortify the tunnel as well as to bring added improvements to adjacent stations and capacity. This $800 million project will not only ensure greater resiliency of our infrastructure against weather events like Superstorm Sandy, but greater reliability of service for hundreds of thousands of L riders daily. As a person who has subscribed to receive email updates, you will automatically receive news and information about the project. We value your contribution to this process, and thank you for participating. Sincerely, L Line Canarsie Reconstruction Project Team

Minor Hudson and Harlem Line Schedule Adjustments Effective August 1

Minor schedule adjustments will be made on the Hudson and Harlem lines on Monday, August 1. On the Hudson Line, due to continued progress on the Sandy Resiliency Project, changes will include substitute bus service at Philipse Manor and Scarborough during AM Reverse Peak and PM Reverse Peak periods. See busing details at http://bit.ly/29WMpV0 . On the Harlem Line, the 6:45 AM train from Southeast to Grand Central will now depart Southeast at 6:42 AM. After Goldens Bridge, the train will follow its current schedule, with no change to the arrival time at Grand Central Terminal. . There are no service changes on the New Haven Line. See more schedule details at http://bit.ly/2afBPLj New timetables are available in Grand Central, at outlying stations, or view our schedules page at http://bit.ly/1arccwk
Weekday Reverse Peak Busing at Philipse Manor & Scarborough Begins August 1

Beginning August 1, certain weekday "reverse peak" trains will not stop at Philipse Manor and Scarborough stations. During these times, customers will connect with shuttle buses at Tarrytown station for travel to/from Philipse Manor and Scarborough. See full details on busing at http://bit.ly/29WMpV0 This change is being done to accommodate construction work related to our Superstorm Sandy Recovery effort.
Grand Central Bound Trains Will Not Stop at Melrose Weekend of July 30-31; Substitute Buses Operate Between Tremont and Melrose

Grand Central Bound Trains will not stop at Melrose on Sat., July 30 & Sun., July 31 to accommodate track work. Weekend southbound busing will take place between Tremont and Melrose stations. Southbound customers traveling to Melrose station will be provided with connecting bus service from Tremont to Melrose. For all southbound customers at Melrose Station buses will be provided to Tremont for connecting train service. See full bus/train schedule details at http://bit.ly/2a6yVI9 We appreciate your patience during this service improvement.

Substitute Busing on New Canaan Branch, July 22 - Aug. 21

Substitute busing will be provided between New Canaan and Stamford stations for select trains on Fridays, and for all trains on Saturdays and Sundays, beginning Friday, July 22 through August 21. Note: Buses will operate 15 to 20 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Please listen for announcements and check local or express bus service to your destination when boarding. Service changes will allow for renewal work on grade crossings. We appreciate your patience during this infrastructure improvement. To see the full schedule, click here http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/NewCanaanBus_714.pdf

Train service btwn Huntington & Hicksville will be reduced to hourly; and between Pt Jefferson & Huntington reduced to every two hours. Allow for additional travel time. Pick up the special Pt Jefferson Br. timetable or visit www.mta.info.

Due to an unauthorized person on the roadbed at Rockaway Blvd, southbound A trains are running with delays. Allow additional travel time.
LIRR Eastbound Trains Bypassing Woodside, Forest Hills and Kew Gardens

LIRR eastbound service is bypassing Woodside, Forest Hills and Kew Gardens due to a track condition east of Woodside. NYC Transit is cross-honoring LIRR fares via the 7 subway at Woodside, and the E subway at Forest Hills and Kew Gardens. For service from Woodside to Jamaica, transfer from the 7 subway to the E subway at 74th St-Broadway. Additionally, customers can take westbound LIRR service to Penn Station and transfer for eastbound service. Port Washington Branch service is not affected.
Port Jefferson Branch Huntington Eastbound Train Bypassing Woodside Station

The 9:35AM train from Penn due Huntington at 10:45AM is bypassing Woodside Station today due to a track condition east of Woodside Station. For service to Woodside, transfer at Jamaica for the next westbound train.

Starting today 7/22, the Flushing-Main Street ticket office will close for a 2-year station renovation project. While the work is underway, Flushing-Main Street customers may buy tickets from LIRR ticket machines, via the new MTA eTix app or at Penn Station ticket windows. Monthly tickets can be ordered through the LIRR's Mail&Ride ticket-by-mail service
Substitute Busing on New Canaan Branch, July 22 - Aug. 21

Substitute busing will be provided between New Canaan and Stamford stations for select trains on Fridays, and for all trains on Saturdays and Sundays, beginning Friday, July 22 through August 21. Note: Buses will operate 15 to 20 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Please listen for announcements and check local or express bus service to your destination when boarding. Service changes will allow for renewal work on grade crossings. We appreciate your patience during this infrastructure improvement. To see the full schedule, click here http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/NewCanaanBus_714.pdf

Substitute Busing on New Canaan Branch, July 22 - Aug. 21

Substitute busing will be provided between New Canaan and Stamford stations for select trains on Fridays, and for all trains on Saturdays and Sundays, beginning Friday, July 22 through August 21. Note: Buses will operate 15 to 20 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Please listen for announcements and check local or express bus service to your destination when boarding. Service changes will allow for renewal work on grade crossings. We appreciate your patience during this infrastructure improvement. Substitute Busing on New Canaan Branch, July 22 - Aug. 21

Substitute busing will be provided between New Canaan and Stamford stations for select trains on Fridays, and for all trains on Saturdays and Sundays, beginning Friday, July 22 through August 21. Note: Buses will operate 15 to 20 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Please listen for announcements and check local or express bus service to your destination when boarding. Service changes will allow for renewal work on grade crossings. We appreciate your patience during this infrastructure improvement. To see the full schedule, click here http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/NewCanaanBus_714.pdf

Substitute Busing on New Canaan Branch, July 22 - Aug. 21

Substitute busing will be provided between New Canaan and Stamford stations for select trains on Fridays, and for all trains on Saturdays and Sundays, beginning Friday, July 22 through August 21. Note: Buses will operate 15 to 20 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Please listen for announcements and check local or express bus service to your destination when boarding. Service changes will allow for renewal work on grade crossings. We appreciate your patience during this infrastructure improvement. To see the full schedule, click here http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/NewCanaanBus_714.pdf

Substitute Busing on New Canaan Branch, July 22 - Aug. 21

Substitute busing will be provided between New Canaan and Stamford stations for select trains on Fridays, and for all trains on Saturdays and Sundays, beginning Friday, July 22 through August 21. Note: Buses will operate 15 to 20 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Please listen for announcements and check local or express bus service to your destination when boarding. Service changes will allow for renewal work on grade crossings. We appreciate your patience during this infrastructure improvement. To see the full schedule, click here http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/NewCanaanBus_714.pdf

With the partial reopening of the Tappan Zee Bridge and the resumption of TZx bus service, Metro-North Railroad's Haverstraw-Ossining Ferry and Newburgh-Beacon Ferry will continue to honor TAPPAN ZEExpress (TZx) bus tickets for the remainder of the day. Customers who normally depart from Grand Central Terminal to connect to the TZx bus at Tarrytown can connect to the ferries by staying on a local train to Ossining, or catching an express train to Beacon. Hudson Line tickets to Tarrytown will be honored for travel at all stations on the Hudson Line, as far as Poughkeepsie. Also, NJTRANSIT and Metro-North are cross-honoring Hudson Line tickets on the Pascack Valley Line.

Transit Alternatives for Tappan ZEExpress Users

Due to this afternoon's crane accident and closure of the Tappan Zee Bridge, the TAPPAN ZEExpress (TZx) bus service is currently unable to operate over the bridge. For this evening's commute, Metro-North's Haverstraw-Ossining Ferry and Newburgh-Beacon Ferry will honor TAPPAN ZEExpress (TZx) bus tickets. Hudson Line tickets to Tarrytown will also be honored for travel at all stations on the Hudson Line, as far as Poughkeepsie. Free TZx shuttle buses will transport riders from the Haverstraw Ferry Landing to the Palisades Center Park & Ride (Lot J), and will provide service on an as-needed basis to points west, including the Palisades Center Stores, Nanuet, Spring, Valley, Airmont and Suffern. Customers to the Nyacks should transfer to TOR #59 at Palisades Center Stores. For more info go to: http://rocklandgov.com//public-transportat/transit-alerts/ NJ TRANSIT is also cross-honoring Hudson Line tickets on the Pascack Valley Line.

Transit Alternatives for Tappan ZEExpress Users

Due to this afternoon's crane accident forcing the closure of the Tappan Zee Bridge, the TAPPAN ZEExpress (TZx) bus service is currently unable to operate over the bridge. For this evening's commute, TZx customers departing Grand Central Terminal (GCT) should consider staying on the Hudson Line train to Ossining, where they can connect to the Haverstraw-Ossining Ferry. TZx UniTickets will be cross-honored by Metro-North. Free TZx shuttle buses will transport riders from the Haverstraw Ferry Landing to the Palisades Center Park & Ride (Lot J), and will provide service on an as-needed basis to points west, including the Palisades Center Stores, Nanuet, Spring, Valley, Airmont and Suffern. Customers to the Nyacks should transfer to TOR #59 at Palisades Center Stores. For more info go to: http://rocklandgov.com/departments/public-transportation/transit-alerts/ NJ TRANSIT is also crossing honoring tickets on the Pascack Valley Line.

Substitute Busing on New Canaan Branch, July 22 - Aug. 21

Substitute busing will be provided between New Canaan and Stamford stations for select trains on Fridays, and for all trains on Saturdays and Sundays, beginning Friday, July 22 through August 21. Note: Buses will operate 15 to 20 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Please listen for announcements and check local or express bus service to your destination when boarding. Service changes will allow for renewal work on grade crossings. We appreciate your patience during this infrastructure improvement. To see the full schedule, click here http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/NewCanaanBus_714.pdf

Starting Next Weekend Substitute Busing on New Canaan Branch, July 22 - Aug. 21

Starting next weekend, substitute busing will be provided between New Canaan and Stamford stations for select trains on Fridays, and for all trains on Saturdays and Sundays, beginning Friday, July 22 through August 21. Note: Buses will operate 15 to 20 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Please listen for announcements and check local or express bus service to your destination when boarding. Service changes will allow for renewal work on grade crossings. We appreciate your patience during this infrastructure improvement. To see the full schedule, click here http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/NewCanaanBus_714.pdf

LIRR Cannonball Express Service to Hamptons

The Cannonball, the LIRR's non-stop express train to the Hamptons operates today, departing Penn Station at 4:06 PM. All luggage MUST fit in the overhead rack or under the seat. Luggage MUST not block aisles or doors. Please listen to announcements or check departure boards for final track assignment. Hamptons Reserve customers on the Cannonball please board on the first three cars of the train. If departing from Track 19, use the staircase to the left of the last LIRR ticket window. See map at http://web.mta.info/lirr/hamptons/HamptonsReservePennMap.jpg

N Line - Weekend and Weekday Planned Service Changes

WEEKEND 11:45 PM Fri to 5 AM Mon, Jul 15 - 18 Astoria-bound N trains are rerouted via the D from Stillwell Av to 36 St. To 86 St, Avenue U, Kings Hwy, Bay Pkwy, 20 Av, 18 Av, Fort Hamilton Pkwy, and 8 Av, take the N to 62 St-New Utrecht Av or 36 St and transfer to a Coney Island-bound N. From these stations, take a Coney Island-bound N to 62 St-New Utrecht Av or Stillwell Av and transfer to an Astoria-bound N. To/from 59 St, 53 St, and 45 St, take the R instead. Transfer between trains at 36 St. NIGHTS 11:45 PM to 6:30 AM, Fri to Sun, Jul 15 - 17 11:45 PM Sun to 5 AM Mon, Jul 17 - 18 36 St-bound N trains stop at 53 St and 45 St. All times until Spring 2017 Astoria-bound N trains skip 86 St, Avenue U, Kings Hwy, 20 Av, 18 Av, New Utrecht Av, and Fort Hamilton Pkwy. N trains stop at Bay Pkwy and 8 Av. To 86 St, Avenue U, and Kings Hwy, take the Astoria-bound N to Bay Pkwy and transfer to a Coney Island-bound N. To 20 Av, 18 Av, New Utrecht Av, and Fort Hamilton Pkwy, take the Astoria-bound N to 8 Av and transfer to a Coney Island-bound N. From these stations, take a Coney Island-bound N to Bay Pkwy or Stillwell Av and transfer to an Astoria-bound N. Or, from New Utrecht Av-62 St, take the D instead. Transfer to an Astoria-bound N at 36 St.
L Line - Weekend Planned Service Change

11:30 PM Fri to 5 AM Mon, Jul 15 - 18 No L trains between Rockaway Pkwy and Myrtle-Wyckoff Avs - take express and local shuttle buses and A/C/J trains. Mobile ticketing is now available on our Hudson Line! See http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo/.
Current Hudson Line Timetable Extended through July 31

The current Hudson Line timetable labeled "Effective through July 10" has been extended to Sunday, July 31 to accommodate ongoing infrastructure improvements. A new timetable will go into effect on Monday, August 1.
Grand Central Bound Trains Will Not Stop at Melrose Weekend of July 9 -10: Substitute Buses Operate Between Tremont and Melrose

Grand Central Bound Trains will not stop at Melrose on Saturday July 9 and Sunday July 10, to accommodate track work. Weekend southbound busing will take place between Tremont and Melrose stations. Southbound customers traveling to Melrose station will be provided with connecting bus service from Tremont to Melrose. For all southbound customers at Melrose Station buses will be provided to Tremont for connecting train service. See full bus/train schedule details at http://bit.ly/29gRiqO We appreciate your patience during this infrastructure improvement.
Wassaic Branch Weekend Substitute Busing July 8 - 10

Weekend substitute bus service will be provided between Southeast and Wassaic for select trains on Friday evening, July 8, and all trains on Saturday July 9 and Sunday July 10, to accommodate reconstruction work for the Towners Crossing on Route 164. Buses will operate 15-30 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Listen for announcements and check Local or Express bus service to your destination while boarding. See bus /train schedules at http://bit.ly/29hPZYt We appreciate your patience during this infrastructure improvement.

Grand Central Bound Trains Will Not Stop at Melrose Weekend of July 9 -10: Substitute Buses Operate Between Tremont and Melrose

Grand Central Bound Trains will not stop at Melrose on Saturday July 9 and Sunday July 10, to accommodate track work. Weekend southbound busing will take place between Tremont and Melrose stations. Southbound customers traveling to Melrose station will be provided with connecting bus service from Tremont to Melrose. For all southbound customers at Melrose Station buses will be provided to Tremont for connecting train service. See full bus/train schedule details at http://bit.ly/29gRiqO We appreciate your patience during this infrastructure improvement.
Current Hudson Line Timetable Extended through July 31.

The current Hudson Line timetable labeled "Effective through July 10" has been extended to Sunday, July 31 to accommodate ongoing infrastructure improvements. A new timetable will go into effect on Monday, August 1.
Wassaic Branch Weekend Substitute Busing July 8 - 10

Weekend substitute bus service will be provided between Southeast and Wassaic for select trains on Friday evening, July 8, and all trains on Saturday July 9 and Sunday July 10, to accommodate reconstruction work for the Towners Crossing on Route 164. Buses will operate 15-30 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Listen for announcements and check Local or Express bus service to your destination while boarding. See bus /train schedules at http://bit.ly/29hPZYt We appreciate your patience during this infrastructure improvement.

Wassaic Branch Weekend Substitute Busing July 8 - 10

Weekend substitute bus service will be provided between Southeast and Wassaic for select trains on Friday evening, July 8, and all trains on Saturday July 9 and Sunday July 10, to accommodate reconstruction work for the Towners Crossing on Route 164. Buses will operate 15-30 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Listen for announcements and check Local or Express bus service to your destination while boarding. See bus /train schedules at http://bit.ly/29hPZYt We appreciate your patience during this infrastructure improvement.
Current Hudson Line Timetable Extended through July 31

The current Hudson Line timetable labeled "Effective through July 10" has been extended to Sunday, July 31 to accommodate ongoing infrastructure improvements. A new timetable will go into effect on Monday, August 1.
Grand Central Bound Trains Will Not Stop at Melrose Weekend of July 9 -10: Substitute Buses Operate Between Tremont and Melrose

Grand Central Bound Trains will not stop at Melrose on Saturday July 9 and Sunday July 10, to accommodate track work. Weekend southbound busing will take place between Tremont and Melrose stations. Southbound customers traveling to Melrose station will be provided with connecting bus service from Tremont to Melrose. For all southbound customers at Melrose Station buses will be provided to Tremont for connecting train service. See full bus/train schedule details at http://bit.ly/29gRiqO We appreciate your patience during this infrastructure improvement.

Wassaic Branch Weekend Substitute Busing July 8 - 10

Buses will operate 15-30 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Listen for announcements and check Local or Express bus service to your destination while boarding. Grand Central Bound Trains Will Not Stop at Melrose Weekend of July 9 -10: Substitute Buses Operate Between Tremont and Melrose

Grand Central Bound Trains will not stop at Melrose on Saturday July 9 and Sunday July 10, to accommodate track work. Weekend southbound busing will take place between Tremont and Melrose stations. Southbound customers traveling to Melrose station will be provided with connecting bus service from Tremont to Melrose. For all southbound customers at Melrose Station buses will be provided to Tremont for connecting train service. See full bus/train schedule details at http://bit.ly/29gRiqO We appreciate your patience during this infrastructure improvement.
